ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
In the past 3 months, has your spouse made you feel well cared for?
In the past 3 months, have you felt respected by your spouse?
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: Your spouse expressed how he felt in a calm and respectful way.
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: Your spouse to see your side of things and listened carefully to what you had to say
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: Your spouse yelled, insulted or swore at you
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: Your spouse threatened you in some way (to leave you, find another partner)
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: Your spouse brought in or tried to bring in someone to help settle things
When you and your spouse argued, how often did he react in the following ways: When the argument got heated your spouse left so that you and he/she could calm down
Overall, how would you describe your relationship with your current spouse?
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Accusations that you are not fulfilling your responsibilities as a parent
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Your spouse's inability or unwillingness to provide for the family
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Other issues around money.
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Your spouse's drinking
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Your drinking
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Concerns about outside partners or accusations of infidelity
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Issues around sex (when to have sex, how often etc.)
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: You disobeying your partner or treating him disrespectfully
During the past 3 months, how often have you and your spouse quarreled about: Disagreements over the children
During the last 4 weeks how often did you and your spouse discuss the following topics together? Things that happened to you during the day.
During the last 4 weeks how often did you and your spouse discuss the following topics together? Things that happened to your spouse during the day.
During the last 4 weeks how often did you and your spouse discuss the following topics together? Your worries or feelings
During the last 4 weeks how often did you and your spouse discuss the following topics together? Your spouse's worries or feelings
During the last 4 weeks how often did you and your spouse discuss the following topics together? Your sexual relationship
Do you feel that your spouse trusts you? Would you say...
Notes: 1= In all matters; 2= In most matters; 3= In some matters; 4= In no matters

ElementDescription: Do you trust your partner? Would you say...
Notes: 1= In all matters; 2= In most matters; 3= In some matters; 4= In no matters
